result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Antoine McAdory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on 9/26/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges by 12/31/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Antoine McAdory

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine Antoine McAdory in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Jermaine Antoine McAdory.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 


AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 206 DAYS time served. 

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges by 12/31/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 9/26/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermaine Antoine McAdory not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding posture of case. Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermaine Antoine McAdory not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time to review offer with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jermaine Antoine McAdory not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Jermaine Antoine McAdory appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
